item.title: Far-Right Party Tries to Expand Its Appeal in Germany’s West
item.description: To reach voters outside its Eastern heartlands, the AfD is putting a new gloss on its anti-immigrant message — while sticking with its agenda.

item.title: Europe Is Finally Ready to Spend More on Defense. The Hard Part Is How.
item.description: After a yearslong debate over NATO spending, European nations are poised to commit more funds to deter Russia. Now the region must decide how to unify...

item.title: With Military Strike His Predecessors Avoided, Trump Takes a Huge Gamble
item.description: President Trump is betting the United States can repel whatever retaliation Iran orders, and that it has destroyed the regime’s chances of reconstitut...

item.title: Mahmoud Khalil Returns to New York After Months in Detention
item.description: The Trump administration remains committed to deporting Mr. Khalil, a Columbia graduate and leading figure in the pro-Palestinian protest movement.

item.title: Midwest Cities Bake as Heat Wave Blankets the Central U.S.
